scenarioDescription:
The K2-90 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-90 is a star with 0.63 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.62 times its radius. It is located 437.66 light years away from the solar system.

K2-90 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-90 system


K2-90 b

K2-90 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-90 b is 7.282 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-90 b is 2.600 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-90 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


K2-90 c

K2-90 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-90 c is 2.242 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-90 c is 1.300 that of Earth. At 2.242 Earth masses, K2-90 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-90, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-90 - System With 2 Exoplanets
